TopicTitle: Whats the stupidest name you've given to one of your ships?

Articles.Content:
Also there was the "You're just not that important to us." Kerbal Rescue SSTO.

Which probably is a small booster with an external seat attached, am I right?
MMMMM- Manned Munar and Minmus Mining Module. It was a Kethane miner that I was using for an orbital station.
"Bruno I and Bruno II"

I'd say a toss-up between the Derpatron series of pre-XenonStorm experimental ion craft, the Very Bad Idea I, and more recently, a slightly failed bird-shaped spaceplane built for a stream named BURRD.

Which probably is a small booster with an external seat attached, am I right?

Close, but you can't really make an SSTO with just a booster.

The one that generates some chuckles, and oddly enough the one I took the most time to name, was the KSA A.R.S.E. (Asteroid Recovery Science Explorer). I try to give my ships acronyms that are kind of silly and also state their purpose. I have not done a proper acronym name in awhile though
It has to be the JTJ, the Jimmy To Jool. The name Jimmy, came off the top of my mind>
D.I.N.G.O. "Duna Inquisitive National Go-cart and Orbiter". A name for one of the rovers I placed on Duna . I also made an "Ike Lobster". It was a mini river with awesome lobster antennae.

Untitled Space CraftMunar Lander

Someone will figure that out after a moment.

close, but you can't really make an ssto with just a booster.

Or... Can you?

CHALLENGE ACCEPTED.

The one that generates some chuckles, and oddly enough the one I took the most time to name, was the KSA A.R.S.E. (Asteroid Recovery Science Explorer). I try to give my ships acronyms that are kind of silly and also state their purpose. I have not done a proper acronym name in awhile though

I was amused at my Jool Atmospheric Return Scientific Expedition!

I'd say mine would be the Hella-copter. It was a surprisingly effective helicopter consisting of 6 jet engines pointed around in a circle. Control was a bit... impossible, but it did fly. Pilots complained of severe dizziness in the rare event that they survived the landing.

I think stupid names are pretty much all I give to various craft that I build in Sandbox. Particularly often recurring ones are the Stupeflyer series spaceplanes, and This Is A Terrible Idea series rocket vehicles.

Medium Orbit Munar Surveyor.

M.O.M.S.

E.K.N

(Every Kerbal's nightmare)

The Nastybird.

(A rocket-to-space then glide-home shuttle. It's (much, much, much smaller) predecessor was called the "Angrybird".)

Barbecued Electronics With Barbecue Sauce.

That was my sun observation probe.

Orbit Test 1 through 7.

(This was my first time in Realism Overhaul - every last of those failed.)
"Spacebus 1" for my first spaceplane, and "Spacetruck 1" for my first heavy cargo rocket.
I name my spaceplanes after types of bird. Once I'd run out of the more usual names, I had to use some less common birds. In my fleet, I have the "Ptarmigan", "Plover" and "Wigeon".

KTC: Kerbal Torture Center.

Basically a giant arm that swings around and then launches a Kerbal (hopefully) high into the air. It was not uncommon (but quite unfortunate) for them to be launched directly into the ground.

It started as a Momentum Exchange Tether, but, well, this was more fun

or my - Destined to Fail 1 - LKO crew vehicle. yes, its still 1! it never failed
"Nowayitisgoingtofly". It flew surprisingly well

Those are similar to my "SSThisWontLandWell", which touched down perfectly. Maybe pessimistically named craft try just a little harder to prove themselves?

Several Lunar landers have had the name "Lunacy"

My current station which is (in the role play sense) a collaboration by several nations, is called the kollabratory.

oh and the dumbest name (which unfortunately I won't share) was one I named after my ex CEO (who cheated me out of 1000's), I flew it into the Sun, it was cathartic.

My first series of ships (no, like actually my first 5 or so ships in the game) were named thus:

Ladybird Book of Rocketry fig.1

Ladybird Book of Rocketry fig.2

etc.

(BTW Ladybird book of rocketry fig.5 was the first object to orbit kerbin in my KSP)
Untitled space craft

"Kerbicide Imminent" was an experimental manned Munar lithobraker. It lived up to its name.

I've also had a series of devices called Sub-Nominal Aerial Flight Utilities. They were makeshift ejection seats with rather excessive TWR.
